channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2023071179
item.description:
Report X-2023071179

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: he cap from the bottle came loose and leaked into the package. DescribePack: The package failed due to the cap coming loose and liquid leakage into the package. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The Package was placing into a red hazmat bin to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071157
item.description:
Report X-2023071157

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and immediately removed from workflow. Package was placed in a plastic tote and retrieved by QA member in Unload area for inspection. DescribePack: External fiberboard container and inner plastic bladder are crushed, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023071077
item.description:
Report X-2023071077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and left on SWAK scale rollers in Unload area for QA inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Two of the caps on the one-gallon bottles were loose, permitting leakage. Package experienced compression/crushing, displacing liquid contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of corrosive liquid.

item.description:
Report X-2023071066

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Contents leaked wetting and contaminating the contents and carton. Upon discovery the pkg was placed in a lined Hazmat bin and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area for inspection and processing. DescribePack: Loose caps on 4 x 1 gal plastic bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in lined Hazmat bin.

item.title: Report X-2023071062
item.description:
Report X-2023071062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: WALLINGFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found while unloading from the trailer. Not sure when the puncture happened. There was obvious internal leakage all over the contents. It was set to the side for the haz mat trained personnel to handle it. DescribePack: One plastic bottle had a puncture that had caused almost the entire gallon to leak out. It leaked all over the other 3 bottles inside the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was brought to the side and turned in such a way to stop the leaking.

item.title: Report X-2023071024
item.description:
Report X-2023071024

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Barcode labels indicates "No-Air" "Home Delivery-Prepaid-ORM-D" shipment in an unmarked outer carton. Contents began to leak wetting the carton and was placed in an unauthorized unlined plastic bin upon discovery of release and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area. Inspection of pkg scans determined the outer carton was never marked with proper Hazmat markings or orientation arrows. DescribePack: Loose trigger spray heads on 4 x 16 oz plastic bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg placed in unauthorized unlined plastic bin.

item.title: Report X-2023071021
item.description:
Report X-2023071021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Four pkgs with Ltd Qty diamonds were packed in an unmarked outer carton and offered for transport. Contents began to leak wetting the inner packaging and outer carton. Inner packaging and contents were placed in an unauthorized unlined plastic bin upon discovery of release and taken to the Hazmat Processing Area. Unmarked outer carton no longer present, presumably discarded by untrained personnel. Inspection of pkg scans determined outer carton was unmarked with no orientation arrows. DescribePack: Loose trigger spray heads on several 32 oz plastic bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents of pkg placed in two separate unauthorized unlined plastic bins.

item.title: Report X-2023070951
item.description:
Report X-2023070951

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: WALLINGFORD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The driver had it loaded on his truck. During his day, he found it and it had internal leakage with a strong odor. He bagged it up with multiple bags until he was able to return to the station. DescribePack: There were dents and obvious crushing evidence. It seems clear it had been mishandled at some point in its journey, possibly multiple points. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: placed in multiple bags

item.title: Report X-2023061363
item.description:
Report X-2023061363

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: ENFIELD
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The forklift operator was driving near the shrink wrapped skid of UN1159 when he clipped a drum of UN1159 with the tire of his forklift near the bottom of the drum. The drum has been turned on its side so it is no longer leaking. A spill crew was sent out for remediation.
